conclusion: The temperature of the gas at state A is -73°C.
The internal energy of the gas changes by 200 J during the process from state A to state C.
Under standard conditions, 1 mole of an ideal gas occupies a volume of 22.4 L.
The p-V diagram shows a process from state A to B to C.
State A is at 3×10^5 Pa and 1×10^-3 m^3.
State B is at 3×10^5 Pa and 4×10^-3 m^3.
State C is at 1×10^5 Pa and 4×10^-3 m^3.
